alert.note: Alert for Carter (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 12 at 6:57PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Carter County through 730 PM EDT... At 656 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles southeast of Veterans Park, or 10 miles southeast of Lexington, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Olive Hill, Carter Caves State Park, Gesling, Carter, Soldier and Globe. This includes Interstate 64 in Kentucky between mile markers 149 and 168. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
